clinical_study.brief_title: Peripheral Blood Stem Cell Transplantation for Hematologic Malignancies With Alpha Beta TCell and B Cell Depletion Using the CliniMACS Device
clinical_study.official_title: BT13BTθ51 Unrelated and Partially Matched Related Donor Peripheral Stem Cell Transplantation With Alpha Beta T Cell and B Cell Depletion For Patients With Hematologic Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm pilot study for patients with hematologic malignancies with alternative donor sources receiving unrelated or partially matched related/Haploidentical mobilized peripheral stem cells (PSCs) using the CliniMACS system for Alpha Beta T cell depletion plus CD19+ B cell depletion to determine efficacy as determined by engraftment and GVHD, and one year leukemia free survival.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to evaluate a new method of T cell depletion using the Miltenyi CliniMACS™ device for patients undergoing a peripheral stem cell transplant utilizing either a unrelated donor or partially matched/haploidentical related donor. This new method is called α/β (alpha/beta) T cell depletion and CD19+ B cell depletion. This pilot study will evaluate if this new method of T cell and B cell depletion is a more effective way of removing T cells thus reducing the risk of severe acute and chronic GVHD and result in a durable engraftment.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the engraftment of patients receiving unrelated donor or partially matched related donor peripheral stem cells that have T cell depleted and CD19+ B cell depleted using the CliniMACS device.
primary_outcome.description: Engraftment will be defined using the standard CIBMTR definition of ANC >500 for the first of 3 consecutive days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the probability of one year leukemia free survival (LFS).
secondary_outcome.description: Leukemia relapse is defined as presence of malignant cells in the blood or other body site after initiation of conditioning in a patient previously in remission.

secondary_outcome.measure: Estimate the incidence and extent of acute and chronic graft vs. host disease.
secondary_outcome.description: Acute GVHD will be graded using the standard Glucksberg grading system.
TRM is defined as death from non-disease related causes in the 100 days from stem cell infusion.

arm_group.description: Alpha Beta T cell depletion is performed for all PBSC grafts using the CliniMACs device

intervention.description: Depletion of Alpha Beta T cells in the PBSC graft

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patient:
1. Age. Patient age < 23 years. Both genders and all races eligible.
2. Disease eligibility
Leukemias/lymphomas:
- Acute myeloid leukemia, primary or secondary
- Disease status: remission or <10% bone marrow blasts
- Myelodysplasia
- Acute lymphoblastic leukemia
- Disease status: in hematologic remission
- Chronic myelogenous leukemia:
- Disease status: chronic phase, accelerated phase or blast crisis now in second chronic phase.
- Mixed lineage or biphenotypic acute leukemia
- Lymphoblastic lymphoma
- Disease status: remission
- Burkitt's lymphoma/leukemia:
- Disease status: in remission
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient
1. Patients who do not meet disease, organ or infectious criteria.
2. No suitable donor
